feed.title: FitTrackee Releases
feed.subtitle: Self-hosted software releases generated by selfh.st

entry.title: New release for FitTrackee: v0.8.10
entry.content:
Features and enhancements

  • #635 - Add ability to replace gpx title when adding a workout
  • #636 - Get description from gpx file if present

Translations

  • #629 - [Translation Request] Russian
  • PR#633 - Translations update (Russian, Dutch, Italian, Galician)
  • PR#637 - Translations update (Spanish, Russian, German and Galician)

Translation status: - Basque: 99% - Bulgarian: 98% - Czech: 72% - Dutch: 99% - English: 100% - French: 100% - Galician: 100% - German: 100% - Italian: 81% - Norwegian Bokm책l: 52% - Polish: 98% - Portuguese: 97% - Russian: 61% - Spanish: 100%

Misc

  • PR#634 - CI - add PostgreSQL 17

Thanks to the contributors: - @boosterl - @gallegonovato - @qwerty287 - @Shura0 - @sikmir - @xmgz

entry.title: New release for FitTrackee: v0.8.11
entry.content:
FitTrackee is now available for Python 3.13. Python 3.8 is no longer supported, the minimum version is now Python 3.9.

Translations

  • PR#640 - Translations update (Basque)
  • PR#645 - Translations update (Russian, Polish)

Translation status: - Basque: 100% - Bulgarian: 98% - Czech: 72% - Dutch: 99% - English: 100% - French: 100% - Galician: 100% - German: 100% - Italian: 81% - Norwegian Bokm책l: 52% - Polish: 100% - Portuguese: 97% - Russian: 62% - Spanish: 100%

Misc

  • #455 - Drop support for Python 3.8
  • #639 - Add support for Python 3.13

Thanks to the contributors: - @erral - @sikmir - Mariuz

entry.title: New release for FitTrackee: v0.8.12
entry.content:
Bugs Fixed

  • #652 - User can not login on new installation

Misc

  • PR#651 - Tests - add databases to parallelize more tests

entry.title: New release for FitTrackee: v0.8.13
entry.content:
Docker images are now available on Docker Hub and GitHub container registry.

Translations

  • PR#667 - Translations update (Galician)

Translation status: - Basque: 100% - Bulgarian: 98% - Czech: 72% - Dutch: 99% - English: 100% - French: 100% - Galician: 100% - German: 100% - Italian: 81% - Norwegian Bokm책l: 52% - Polish: 100% - Portuguese: 97% - Russian: 62% - Spanish: 100%

Misc

  • #126 - Docker's Container on docker hub
  • PR#673 - Publish package on PyPI using GitHub Actions workflow

Thanks to the contributors: - @DavidHenryThoreau - @xmgz

entry.title: New release for FitTrackee: v0.9.0
entry.content:
FitTrackee now allows you to follow other users, view their workouts according to the level of visibility and interact with them.

The default privacy policy has been updated, as well as the link to the documentation.

[!NOTE] This version also includes the changes from the beta versions.

Features and enhancements

  • #16 - Add social features [1st part]
  • #125 - Add followers/following and visibility levels
  • #296 - Add comments
  • #298 - Add likes
  • #299 - UI notifications
  • #381 - Block a user to hide unwanted content
  • #382 - Moderation tools
  • #655 - Add moderator and owner roles
  • PR#666 - Display last 5 workouts in user profile
  • PR#675 - CLI - create user with provided role
  • #691 Support Markdown syntax in description and notes

Bugs Fixed

  • #664 - privacy policy validation is not displayed
  • #682 - Monthly statistics are incorrect
  • #683 - User time zone is not taken into account in statistics
  • #680 - accessibility and style fixes

Translations

  • PR#688 - Translations update (Basque, Galician)
  • PR#690 - Translations update (English, French, Basque, Galician)
  • PR#692 - Translations update (French)
  • PR#695 - Translations update (Chinese)
  • PR#696 - Translations update (Galician)
  • #697 - [translations request] Chinese (Simplified Han script)

Translation status: - Basque: 72% - Bulgarian: 64% - Chinese (Simplified): 48% - Czech: 47% - Dutch: 64% - English: 100% - French: 100% - Galician: 100% - German: 64% - Italian: 53% - Norwegian Bokm책l: 34% - Polish: 64% - Portuguese: 63% - Russian: 64% - Spanish: 64%

Misc

  • PR#685 - Update link to documentation

Thanks to the contributors: - @erral - @xmgz - Poesty Li

[!NOTE] If you upgrade from the v0.8.x, there are migrations to apply (see upgrade instructions in documentation)
